protein.general_function: Involved in Rho guanyl-nucleotide exchange factor activity
protein.specific_function: Guanine nucleotide exchange factor that potentially links pathways that signal through RAC1, RHOA and CDC42. Catalyzes guanine nucleotide exchange on RHOA and CDC42 and interacts specifically with the GTP-bound form of RAC1, suggesting that it functions as an effector of RAC1. May also participate in axonal transport in the brain. Becomes activated and highly tumorigenic by truncation of the N-terminus. Isoform 5 activates CDC42

go_class.description: regulation of small gtpase mediated signal transduction
regulation of ras protein signal transduction
regulation of rho protein signal transduction

reference.reference_text: Ueda S, Kataoka T, Satoh T: Role of the Sec14-like domain of Dbl family exchange factors in the regulation of Rho family GTPases in different subcellular sites. Cell Signal. 2004 Aug;16(8):899-906.
